pt: {sc}splendid{/sc} {sc}resplendent{/sc} {sc}gorgeous{/sc} {sc}glorious{/sc} {sc}sublime{/sc} {sc}superb{/sc} mean extraordinarily or transcendently impressive. {sc}splendid{/sc} implies outshining the usual or customary.
{sc}resplendent{/sc} suggests a glowing or blazing splendor.
{sc}gorgeous{/sc} implies a rich splendor especially in display of color.
{sc}glorious{/sc} suggests radiance that heightens beauty or distinction.
{sc}sublime{/sc} implies an exaltation or elevation almost beyond human comprehension.
{sc}superb{/sc} suggests an excellence reaching the highest conceivable degree.

et: Latin {it}splendidus{/it}, from {it}splendēre{/it} to shine; perhaps akin to Middle Irish {it}lainn{/it} bright
shortdef: possessing or displaying splendor: such as
